intro: Geoblasta bergii, commonly known as the Berg's geoblasta, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, feather-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. It thrives in rocky, coastal habitats and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
